intro: Calophaca tianschanica, commonly known as the Tianshan calophaca, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the Tianshan mountain range. It is a herbaceous perennial with distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbellate clusters, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
